person.persName: Robert Blain, Jr. (Lincoln County farmer, attorney, and politician)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer, politician, and attorney. Grainger County, Tennessee, native. Married to Catharine R. Hawkins Blain. Father of R.D. Clay Blain, William M. Blain, Fanny Blain, John A. Blain, Elizabeth Blain, and Kate Blain. Served in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for Lincoln County from 1849-1850. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1850. Owned 6 enslaved persons in 1850. Successful Whig candidate for Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from the 23rd Congressional District (Lincoln and Pulaski counties) from 1853-1857. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned 12 enslaved persons in 1860.
